definition: to send out/to show (one's feeling)/to issue/to develop/to make a bundle of money/classifier for gunshots (rounds)

sentences.english: Encourage her release by constructing an erotic fantasy before things heat up.
sentences.chinese: 應當在高潮激發前鼓勵她通過性幻想放鬆自己。

sentences.english: Throughout their history, the pyramids of Giza have stimulated human imagination.
sentences.chinese: 縱觀歷史，吉薩金子塔激發了人類的想象。

sentences.english: Thirdly, Trammell was really a good rival.
sentences.chinese: 第三，特拉梅爾是一位可以激發劉翔潛能的對手。

sentences.english: In doing this, more people will be inspired and encouraged to write.
sentences.chinese: 如此拋磚引玉，能激發與鼓勵更多人加入寫作隊伍。

sentences.english: Most managers attempt to influence employee motivation using both positive and negative approaches.
sentences.chinese: 大多數經理試圖正負雙法並舉，激發員工的積極性。

sentences.english: Point blank, it increases brain function. Barlean's makes a fish oil foam called Omega Swirl that tastes like candy.
sentences.chinese: 它能夠激發空白點，提高腦功能。

sentences.english: The design of the film-systems used for bio-fluorescence excitation and barrier filters were discussed in this paper.
sentences.chinese: 本文論述生物熒光激發濾光片及柵濾光片的膜系設計。

sentences.english: Let your kids rest on pillows designed to inspire musical dreams.
sentences.chinese: 讓你的孩子們偎依在能激發音樂夢想的枕頭上。

sentences.english: It is that quantitative difference that drives the interest in digital TV.
sentences.chinese: 正是這種質量差別激發我們對數字電視的興趣。

sentences.english: Improve the production efficiency, improve the overall quality, potential to inspire.
sentences.chinese: 提高生產效率，提升員工整體素質，潛質激發。

sentences.english: The labor song is the oldest ballad directly originating from physical labor.
sentences.chinese: 勞動歌是由體力勞動直接激發起來的最古老的歌謠。

sentences.english: The new classification has certainly caught the imagination of Internet users.
sentences.chinese: 這種新的分類當然激發了網友們的奇思妙想。

sentences.english: According to the Law of Attraction, a powerful intent made up of clear, pure and focused thoughts will start to attract the very essence of your desires.
sentences.chinese: 根據引力定律，一個明確的想法會激發你的所有慾望。

sentences.english: The power of the mind's creativity depends on the constant stimulation and encouragements.
sentences.chinese: 心靈的創造力是需要被時時的激發的。

sentences.english: But such triggers don't seem to trouble the patients with a damaged insula.
sentences.chinese: 但是這種激發看來已不會困擾島葉皮層損傷的患者。

sentences.english: Snow shoveling is a known trigger for heart attacks.
sentences.chinese: 剷雪是一個已知的心臟病發作激發因素。

definition: to display/to exhibit/to bring out implicit or innate qualities/to express (a thought or moral)/to develop (an idea)/to elaborate (on a theme)
to release/to set free/to liberate (a prisoner)/to discharge
to create/to bring about/to produce/to set (a record)
to enlighten/to explain (a text etc)/to stimulate (a mental attitude)/enlightenment/revelation/motivation
to push (for acceptance of a plan)/to push forward/to promote/to actuate/CL:個|个[ge4]
to come out/to emerge/to reveal/to display
to cultivate/to breed/to foster/to nurture/to educate/to groom (for a position)/education/fostering/culture (biology)
